answers.answer: Those #'s mean different things to different people.  There are people on here whose #'s are in the 5000-7000 range and mine was 61 when my onc told me I was not in remission anymore.You can't say oh, 61 is a little cancer 1900 more cancer or 5000 is a lot of cancer.  For some people the #'s never get low and some never get high.If I remember right (chemo brain sorry) your mom just saw an onc on Thursday right?  That number will come down drastically once she has her surgery and with chemo should come down even more.Chemo is not based on that number.  It isn't like you have to have more chemo if your numbers are high.  Everybody pretty much gets the same 6 rounds of carbo/taxol.Your mom did decide to let him do her surgery didn't she?Jan

Jan, thanks - I guess I needed someone to just explain that.  I don't really understand the CA125 thing but when the doctor said 1900 and the normal number is under 21 I thought it was a surety that my mom was in stage IV and dying. She is 74 and always been my rock.  She has been so healthy (except for breast cancer 12 years ago that she "skated" through).  My dad is the one with the triple bypass, pace maker and diabetes.   I know we all have to have our parents die but I just didn't want it so soon or like this.  My daughter is 20 months old and hasn't gotten to know her grandma enough.  My mom and dad adore their grandchildren and can't wait to give her the world....I really want to let them.Thank you....I keep saying this.... but all of you amaze me.

Hello...I'm one of those who Jan referred to as my current CA.125 is 5750, but it's been as high as 7500, but I don't take any notice of the numbers, as my Oncol. tells me that others with lower numbers could have more active cancer than I do. I'm feeling well, lead an active life and my appetite is really good. Dx.Stage 4 ...Feb'04 and still going well. Stage 4 isn't an immediate death sentence. In my mind, I'm going to be around for lots more years. :-)   Hugs to you and your Mum...Helen...

In reading about your mom i was wondering if any one else on her side of the family has had breast cancer or ovarian.  to have both might give the possiblity that she is aBraca I carrier.  There would have to be other family members berfore insurance would look into it.  I am a Braca I  i had an aunt with breat and grandmother with ovarian.  My daughter and son 22 and 25 with be tested to see where they are.  It would be helpful to you and your daughter to know and rule it out.  Good luck with your Mom with family around she will do well.  hugs to all

question: What does a reading of 1900 from the CA125 mean?  I know it means Ovarian cancer and I know the number should be under 21 (what the doctor said).  What was not told to me was how high others have been, if 1900 was sky high, mid range or low for actually having OC....
title: CA125
